title: David Forster -- Introduction to Soil Minerals

tasks.task: Give a series of tasks based on the transcript of a farming and soil science presentation by David Forster, focusing on physical tasks related to understanding and enhancing soil fertility.
subtasks: Understand the components of soil fertility (air, water, minerals, biology).
Evaluate TEC to determine nutrient-holding capacity.
Interpret base saturation percentages for cations to assess balance.
Calculate sulfur addition needs based on ppm to pounds conversion.
Address magnesium excess by applying calcium through gypsum or limestone.
Add trace elements considering maximum annual rates and slow release.
Adjust pH and nutrient availability based on pH's influence on uptake.
Apply trace elements using foliar sprays and organic sources.
Dilute calcic applications for gradual release and avoid abrupt pH changes.
Monitor elemental applications and make adjustments as needed for balanced soil.
